result.execSummary:
The defendant Mia M Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mia M Ruiz

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

10:54 AM 
Clerk: Amy. 
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Anna Feddick Goodwin. 

Date and time set for JPTC; VRCW.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to REMOVE Repeater enhancer on Count 1; COURT GRANTS. 

PLEA>>
Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse): NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 10 days MCJ with huber for work or EMP if eligible.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

Adj: 11:03 a.m.
ATTIC:  Intake Report - Pretrial Services Program

records.addlTxt: State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski; defendant appears by Attorney Alana Feddick-Goodwin by phone.  Parties continue negotiations and keep future court dates on the calendar.
